item.title: Clifford operations
item.description: Clifford operations generate a subset of all possible operations in Quantum computation, see Universal Quantum Gate set for more information.

item.title: 9 qubits code (Shor's code)
item.description: Using encoding on 9 Qubits, it is possible to correct any kind of noise induced on a single qubit.

item.title: Steane code
item.description: The Steane code is obtained by applying the CSS code procedure to the [7,4,3]-Hamming code.

item.title: Surface Code
item.description: Surface code on a torus The surface code can be defined on a square grid of size L \times L, where Qubits sit on the edges, as shown here for L=4: The code is easier to analyze at first when considering periodic boundary conditions.

item.title: Syndromes
item.description: Error syndromes in the stabilizer formalism record when an element of the codespace is transformed under a Pauli operator E which anticommutes with some generator S_i of the stabilizer group \mathcal{S}.

item.title: Tanner graphs
item.description: Many methods to design quantum codes and decoders work by representing stabilizer codes using their so-called Tanner graph.

item.title: Universal Turing Machine (UTM)
item.description: Since every element for a fixed Turing machine is finite, we can associate said Turing machine to a specific natural number through a bijective function.
